column3: Oh, also a simple flag to getblock so you can get only the header. That one is not related to sidechains, but I needed it while debugging.\n
Fixed all the nits that we're related to header-include (I believe we removed that from our coding standards?)\n
We did; #5201. Still, feel free to follow them :)\n
@TheBlueMatt You as a core dev, I really would love to see you still following that rules :).\n
Fixed include ordering for includes related to this pull (others are related to #5181)\n
Rebased on top of the now-merged #5181, also now support multiple transactions in one proof.\n
Concept ACK, but this new  functionality needs a test in `qa/rpc-tests`.\n
@laanwj done.\n
Rebased, fixed an indentation error, removed the blockheader-only option (meh, people can just substring(0, 160) anyway...)\n
Rebased. Review?\n
Tested ACK.\n
utACK\n
coins should be before core ;)\n
utilstrencodings should be below utilmoneystr\n
core before hash\n
Woulnd't need an else block, right?\n
Same here, ordering.\n
This looks like we require 2 arguments here, block and hash, but its only 1 blockhash, so I would remove the space between the two.\n
That is #5181 and is code-move-only, so I dont want to change it.\n
Done.\n
Right, but most of the time these nits or improvement suggestions are not catched by anyone later on anyway ;).\n

headeronly (boolean) would need to be mentioned in the arguments here.

BTW: what about adding a `getblockheader` call, instead of adding a boolean argument? I'd slightly prefer that for readability/simplicity. It would only result in minimal code duplication.
ping @thebluematt\n
